name: CGImageAlphaInfo
desc: Storage options for alpha component data.

items.name: case first
items.desc: The alpha component is stored in the most significant bits of each pixel. For example, non-premultiplied ARGB.

items.name: case last
items.desc: The alpha component is stored in the least significant bits of each pixel. For example, non-premultiplied RGBA.

items.name: case noneSkipFirst
items.desc: There is no alpha channel. If the total size of the pixel is greater than the space required for the number of color components in the color space, the most significant bits are ignored.

items.name: case alphaOnly
items.desc: There is no color data, only an alpha channel.

items.name: case premultipliedFirst
items.desc: The alpha component is stored in the most significant bits of each pixel and the color components have already been multiplied by this alpha value. For example, premultiplied ARGB.

items.name: case premultipliedLast
items.desc: The alpha component is stored in the least significant bits of each pixel and the color components have already been multiplied by this alpha value. For example, premultiplied RGBA.
